Edit this page

kazu.utils.link_index#

Classes

CDistTensorEmbeddingIndex

Calculate embedding based on cosine distance

DictionaryIndex

The dictionary index looks for SynonymTerms via a char ngram search between the normalised version of the query string and the term_norm of all SynonymTerms associated with the provided OntologyParser.

EmbeddingIndex

a wrapper around an embedding index strategy.

Index

base class for all indices.

MatMulTensorEmbeddingIndex

calculate embedding based on MatMul

TensorEmbeddingIndex

a simple index of torch tensors.
class kazu.utils.link_index.CDistTensorEmbeddingIndex[source]#

Bases: TensorEmbeddingIndex

Calculate embedding based on cosine distance

class kazu.utils.link_index.DictionaryIndex[source]#

Bases: Index

The dictionary index looks for SynonymTerms via a char ngram search between the normalised version of the query string and the term_norm of all SynonymTerms associated with the provided OntologyParser.

__init__(parser, boolean_scorers=None)[source]#
Parameters:

  • parser (OntologyParser) –

  • boolean_scorers (Optional[List[BooleanStringSimilarityScorer]]) – precision can be increased by applying boolean checks on the returned result, for instance, checking that all integers are represented, that any noun modifiers are present etc

apply_boolean_scorers(reference_term, query_term)[source]#
Parameters:

  • reference_term (str) –

  • query_term (str) –

Return type:

bool

search the index

Parameters:

  • top_n (int) – return a maximum of top_n SynonymTermWithMetrics

  • query (str) – a string of text

Returns:

Return type:

Iterable[SynonymTermWithMetrics]

enumerate_database_chunks(name, chunk_size=100000)[source]#

generator to split up a dataframe into partitions

Parameters:

  • name (str) – ontology name to query the metadata database with

  • chunk_size (int) – size of partittions to create

Returns:

Return type:

Iterable[Tuple[int, Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[bool, int, float, str]]]]]

predict_ontology_embeddings(name)[source]#

since embeddings are memory hungry, we use a generator to partition an input dataframe into manageable chucks, and add them to the index sequentially

Parameters:

name (str) – name of ontology

Returns:

partition number, metadata and embeddings

Return type:

Iterator[Tuple[int, Dict[str, Dict[str, Union[bool, int, float, str]]], Tensor]]

search(query, top_n=1)[source]#
Parameters:

  • query (Tensor) – a query tensor

  • top_n (int) – return top_n instances of SynonymTermWithMetrics

Returns:

Return type:

Iterable[SynonymTermWithMetrics]

set_embedding_model(embedding_model, trainer=None)[source]#

set the embedding model to be used to generate target ontology embeddings when the cache is generated (currently only PLSapbertModel supported). Also, optionally set a PL Trainer that should be used (a Trainer configured with default params will be used otherwise)

Parameters:

  • embedding_model (PLSapbertModel) –

  • trainer (Optional[Trainer]) –

Returns:

save(directory, overwrite=False)[source]#

save to disk. Makes a directory at the path location with all the index assets

Parameters:

  • directory (Path) – a dir to save the index.

  • overwrite (bool) – should the directory be deleted before attempting to save? (CAREFUL!)

a Path to where the index was saved
